_header: All be that of my fare or silly case
_description:
The Miseries of True Love, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 71) — three 8-line stanzas and 5-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines: All be that of my fare or sely caseI gesse ye take full litill remembraunce…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …Ageynn daungere which hath me in manaunceGod wot in what afore cursid party
BLHar682.Note: Penultimate line partially rubbed out, later hand adds alternate reading to left margin: “[   ] which daungere falyn at destance” (f. 17v).
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 682.
